metadata.TITLE: Catch Up On The Latest News Clips - ITVX
metadata.DESC: Discover the latest and breaking news clips from ITV. ITVX - The UK's freshest streaming service.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: The latest headlines - as over a hundred arrested across UK at events related to Palestine Action
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Catch up with the latest UK and international headlines from the ITV News team.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Donald Trump threatens to sue Rupert Murdoch over allegations linking him to Jeffery Epstein
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Trump promised a lawsuit after The Wall Street Journal reports on sexually suggestive letter, allegedly signed by him, and found in Epstein's birthday album.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Syria's interim president calls for a ceasefire after hundreds die in clashes between rival militias
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Syria’s President Ahmad al-Sharaa has urged Sunni Bedouin tribes to honor a ceasefire aimed at ending deadly clashes with Druze-linked militias Sweida.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Serious water pollution incidents in England up 60% last year
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: New data from the Environment Agency found that, last year,  a total of 75 category 1 and 2 incidents were recorded - up from 47 in 2023.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Tributes paid at school after one child killed and others seriously injured in Somerset bus crash
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: The coach was carrying 60-70 passengers and was heading back to Minehead Middle School.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Postmistress wrongly convicted of theft is the first to have her case referred to Court of Appeal
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Patricia Owen died in 2003, long before details of the Post Office's failures came to light.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Spies and special forces among more than 100 Britons’ details included in Afghan data leak
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Details of MI6 spies, SAS and special forces personnel were included in the data leak that resulted in thousands of Afghans being secretly relocated to the UK

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Gaza's deadly aid sites: What's going wrong?
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: As of July 13th the UN has recorded 674 people killed in the vicinity of the new US-Israel backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation sites.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Drilling Antarctica: What ice can tell us about our past and the future
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Scientists have drilled down into the ice and extracted a core which is 2.8km long where the deepest part could be up to 1.5million years old.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Talking Royals: The King and Prince Harry’s ‘peace summit’, and Queen Camilla’s quirky birthday gift
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Charlene is joined by Chris and Lizzie to discuss the not-so-secret meeting between the King and Harry's teams. Plus, what do you gift a Queen on her birthday?

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Thunderstorms on the way: Watch the latest ITV forecast
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Watch the latest UK forecast from the ITV Weather team.
Catch up with the latest UK and international headlines from the ITV News team.

clips.episodeTitle: The Evolution of Putin: Bullied Child, KGB Man, Autocrat
clips.programmeTitle: The Evolution of Putin: Bullied Child, KGB Man, Autocrat

clips.episodeTitle: 'We wish we'd never asked for help': Family's hurt as thousands with learning disabilities locked up
clips.synopsis: Exclusive analysis by Mencap, for ITV News, shows more than 2,000 people with autism and learning disabilities locked away in in-patient units across England.

clips.episodeTitle: Activist Mahmoud Khalil: Trump administration targeting those who don't fit its vision of America
clips.synopsis: In his first interview with a UK broadcaster, Mahmoud Khalil tells ITV News that his arrest was "the heaviest moment" of his life.

clips.episodeTitle: Empty houses, broken communities: one month on from the Ballymena riots
clips.synopsis: Peter Smith visits Ballymena in Northern Ireland - a town which is still reeling one month after riots aimed mainly at the Roma community.

clips.episodeTitle: Son of Iran's last Shah: Regime 'on verge of collapse' and 'scared of its own people'
clips.synopsis: Reza Pahlavi, the son of Iran's last Shah, went into exile almost five decades ago. He is often seen as a viable next leader by opponents of the current regime.

clips.episodeTitle: Air India Flight 171: Disaster in the Skies
clips.programmeTitle: Air India Flight 171: Disaster in the Skies

clips.episodeTitle: 47 hours left to live: ITV News witnesses an assisted death in Oregon
clips.synopsis: Jessica was able to legally access the drugs in her home state of Oregon, USA, where assisted dying has been available for almost thirty years.

clips.episodeTitle: At least 95 women were killed by men previously known to police over the course of 5 years
clips.synopsis: In the majority of these cases the women themselves reported the men for domestic related incidents and in 20 cases clear police failings have been identified.

clips.episodeTitle: Gang steals £2 million: Inside the shoplifting crime wave | Criminal Gangs Exposed Part 1
clips.synopsis: In Part 1 of ITV News' Theft Gangs series, Antoine Allen investigates the rise of “stolen to order” shoplifting. What’s driving it, and can it be stopped?

clips.episodeTitle: Tool theft crime wave: Unmasking the boot sale thieves | Criminal Gangs Exposed Part 2
clips.synopsis: In Theft Gangs Part 2: Stolen Tools, Antoine Allen investigates the black market for stolen tools — where rogue traders profit off the misery of tradespeople.

clips.episodeTitle: Women rowers at 'medal factory' Leander Club walked out over personal safety fears
clips.synopsis: The club has been accused of ignoring the safety fears of its own female rowers, leading them to refuse to train with their male teammates.

clips.episodeTitle: Talking Politics Exclusive: Simon Case on why China's Taiwan intent is an enormous threat to the UK
clips.synopsis: In this special edition of Talking Politics, Robert Peston meets ex-Civil Service chief Simon Case, the Cabinet Secretary to 4 Prime Ministers

clips.episodeTitle: How ‘sheer bravado’ got the Sycamore Gap duo jailed
clips.synopsis: Daniel Graham and Adam Carruthers have been jailed for over 4 years for felling the iconic tree. Are we any closer to knowing why they did it?

clips.episodeTitle: What the next few days have in store as third summer heatwave hits UK
clips.synopsis: The third heatwave of the year hit parts of the UK on Friday, but Sunday will gradually start to turn a little cooler and cloudier in the north and east.

clips.episodeTitle: How will the UK-France migrant deal work? The numbers explained
clips.synopsis: ITV News explains the numbers behind Starmer's plan to tackle small boat crossings. What is the 'one in, one out' plan?

clips.episodeTitle: Talking Politics: Why we could all be carrying ID cards in new migration controls
clips.synopsis: Tom and Robert discuss the flaws in Britain and France's new effort to stop the boats. Plus, why we could be carrying identity cards before the next election.

clips.episodeTitle: What does it take to prepare a royal state banquet?
clips.synopsis: Macron is the latest of many world leaders to be hosted by the King and Queen - but what does it take to pull off one of the most high-profile dinners?

clips.episodeTitle: Labour's First Year: How has Starmer tackled key issues since winning the election?
clips.synopsis: ITV News looks at how the Government is dealing with the economy, health, immigration and housing in its first year in office.

clips.episodeTitle: Talking Royals: Kate's life after treatment, farewell to the Royal Train and William's team talk
clips.synopsis: This week, Charlene is joined by Chris and Lizzie to discuss Kate's life after treatment. Plus, why the Royal Train's days are numbered and William's team talk.

clips.episodeTitle: What's Labour's next embarrassing U-turn? Talking Politics Q&A on one year of PM Starmer
clips.synopsis: In this week's Q&A, Tom Bradby and Robert Peston answer our audience’s questions on Labour to mark 12 months in government.

clips.episodeTitle: Amanda Knox: How I tell my kids mummy was jailed for murder
clips.synopsis: Ten years after her definitive exoneration for Meredith Kercher's killing, she describes being "forever branded the girl accused of murder."

clips.episodeTitle: Talking Politics USA: A week of wins for 'Daddy' Trump & what Mamdani's win means for the Democrats
clips.synopsis: Our Washington producer Aisha Kherallah and correspondent Rachel Younger joins Tom Bradby to discuss the latest following a week of wins for the president.

clips.episodeTitle: Welfare bill passes after PM drops key reform in last-minute concession
clips.synopsis: The government won a vote on its controversial, watered down welfare bill on Tuesday night - but faced its biggest backbench rebellion so far.

clips.episodeTitle: When would the UK deploy its new nuclear bomb-carrying fighter jets?
clips.synopsis: Air defence expert and RUSI fellow Dr Thomas Withington discusses the UK's procurement of F-35A nuclear-carrying fighter jets and what they are capable of.

clips.episodeTitle: Antarctica: End of the Earth
Behind the scenes in Antarctica
clips.synopsis: A behind the scenes look at how we filmed our epic journey to the continent of Antarctica

clips.episodeTitle: Christmas in Antarctica: Shortest day celebrations in full swing
clips.synopsis: For the small community of British Antarctic Survey staff who live there, the occasion is treated like Christmas.

clips.episodeTitle: Renowned conservationist Jane Goodall on the importance of young people protecting our planet
clips.synopsis: Jane Goodall reflects on the state of the climate, the importance of conservation work and the job of young people to protect the future of our planet.

clips.episodeTitle: Antarctica's hidden sea life could be used for washing powders and ice creams
clips.synopsis: Equipped head-to-toe in dry suits - divers researching below the waves are tethered to a team above the ice to make sure they don’t lose the hole to get back.

clips.episodeTitle: How a warming climate increases the risks and dangers for British scientists in Antartica
clips.synopsis: In Antarctica, the climate is changing and so is the way scientists work. Hidden under the snow are crevasses which can go down for dozens of metres.

clips.episodeTitle: Whales in Antarctica at risk once again due to industrial fishing and microplastics
clips.synopsis: Super trawlers are endangering whales with their fishing nets whilst also plundering vast quantities of krill which is the whales main food source.

clips.episodeTitle: The Prime Minister of the Bahamas Philip Davis told ITV News about his fears for the future
clips.synopsis: All this week we've been reporting live from Antarctica on the impact climate change is having there and how that is also affecting the rest of the planet.

clips.episodeTitle: Former Secretary of State calls on experts to 'put your science on the line' to save Antarctica
clips.synopsis: John Kerry talks about the climate crisis in Antarctica and accuses Trump of "turning his back on the greatest marketplace the world has ever known"

clips.episodeTitle: Starmer insists he's talked to Trump about climate change in exclusive interview
clips.synopsis: Our Science Correspondent Martin Stew pressed the Prime Minister on how seriously he's taking the climate crisis in an interview conducted from Antarctica.

clips.episodeTitle: Questions raised over effectiveness of the UN's Ocean Conference after notable US absence
clips.synopsis: French President says "the sea is not for sale" at the UN Ocean Conference. But the summit's effectiveness was questioned with the notable absence of the US.

clips.episodeTitle: Sea sickness and spotting icebergs: Life on board an Antarctic expedition in deep winter
clips.synopsis: ITV News's Martin Stew embarks on a journey aboard the RRS Sir David Attenborough, deep within the Antarctic Circle.

clips.episodeTitle: Murder probe detective says Katie Simpson's death should be 'watershed moment'
clips.synopsis: A former detective who helped bring Jonathan Creswell to trial says by taking his own life he remained in control until the very end.

clips.episodeTitle: Boy, 14, on the challenges of caring for his step-mum who has cancer
clips.synopsis: Leon Surcouf from Jersey started looking after his step-mum following her diagnosis and wants more young carers to be aware of the support which is available.

clips.episodeTitle: Three children live with CRELD1 in the UK and there is currently no cure
clips.synopsis: The condition causes a huge range of symptoms from seizures, to development delay and heart issues

clips.episodeTitle: Shining a light on support for young people in one of our most deprived communities
clips.synopsis: More than 3,000 young people have joined Salford Youth Zone since it opened, but the centre is just one example of how young people are given voice in the city

clips.episodeTitle: Experts warn dermal fillers may never leave the face
clips.synopsis: Filler is often used to turn back the clock but as some are now discovering, reversing those results doesn’t always mean going back to where you started.

clips.episodeTitle: 'He dismembered my daughter's body': Mum's fight to keep killer imprisoned
clips.synopsis: The mother of a Chantel Taylor, who was murdered and then dismembered 21 years ago, says she will "fight" to keep her killer in prison until her body is found.

clips.episodeTitle: Steve Cram: NINETEEN85
clips.synopsis: Ian Payne heads back to the summer of 1985 with the Jarrow Arrow as he marks 40 years since breaking three world records in a run of races over 19 days.

clips.episodeTitle: Some pupils are arriving at secondary school with reading ages as low as five
clips.synopsis: It's thought the impact of covid, phones and tablets, and a lack of reading at home could be to blame.

clips.episodeTitle: Sycamore Gap: Britain's Lost Landmark
clips.synopsis: As two men are sentenced for felling one of the world's most iconic trees, Tom Barton reports on the crime, the police investigation and asks why they did it?

clips.episodeTitle: Call for action after a rise in misuse and thefts of Blue Badges
clips.synopsis: One disabled driver had their car broken into twice as thieves targeted her Blue Badge.

clips.episodeTitle: A special graduation ceremony at a circus school with students showing their talents
clips.synopsis: Graduates at the East Sussex School of Circus Arts in Hailsham demonstrated their strength, technique and bravery learnt over the past year.

clips.episodeTitle: Is this 79-year-old Peterborough paperboy the oldest in the country?
clips.synopsis: Brian Dunmore works seven days a week, delivering 50 papers on every round - and says he loves the buzz

clips.episodeTitle: 'TV for the Tiktok generation': Microdramas are on the rise in the UK
clips.synopsis: The genre which consists of minute-long episodes designed for smartphones has experienced a boom with the market predicted to be worth $14bn (£11bn) by 2027.

clips.episodeTitle: Headteacher Mr T ends school term with final Friday rave
clips.synopsis: As the school term ends for the summer break, one headteacher in Leicester has a very unique way of ending each week.

clips.episodeTitle: Oasis reunion tour kicks off in Cardiff
clips.synopsis: Tens of thousands of fans gathered for the Gallagher brothers' performance at the Principality Stadium in Cardiff.

clips.episodeTitle: McLaren F1 driver Lando Norris reflects on competing against teammates and driving with Brad Pitt
clips.synopsis: The 25-year-old looks ahead to Sunday's British Grand Prix, after winning seven Grand Prix titles across as many seasons with McLaren.

clips.episodeTitle: Black Sabbath get the band back together ahead of final gig at Villa Park
clips.synopsis: "The greatest heavy metal show ever" is coming to Birmingham as Ozzy Osbourne reunites with all his original Black Sabbath bandmates for his final performance.

clips.episodeTitle: 28 Years Later: Jodie Comer on acting in a 'Danny Boyle horror'
clips.synopsis: ITV News Arts Editor Nina Nannar sat down with 28 Years Later star Jodie Comer and director Danny Boyle to discuss why it couldn't wait five year later.

clips.episodeTitle: Girl who lost leg to cancer says nothing will stop her achieving her dreams
clips.synopsis: Eleven-year-old Millie Blair from Warmington near Peterborough wants to be able to walk again before she goes to secondary school in September

clips.episodeTitle: Meet the search and rescue dogs playing a daily game of life and death
clips.synopsis: More than a dozen dogs from fire brigades across the country have been in Washington, England's only specialist facilities, for their yearly assessments.

clips.episodeTitle: What happened the last time Harry Potter, Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger were cast?
clips.synopsis: ITV News has taken a trip back to August 2000, when the original movie cast held their first press conference.

clips.episodeTitle: Harry Kane tells ITV News about title relief, watching Spurs and World Cup dream with England
clips.synopsis: In his first sit-down interview since winning the Bundesliga, England captain Harry Kane speaks to ITV News Sports Editor Steve Scott.

clips.episodeTitle: Austria's JJ wins the 2025 Eurovision Song Contest
clips.synopsis: Austrian singer JJ won the Eurovision trophy in a nail-biting finish, pro-Palestine protestors had earlier tried to rush the stage during Israel's performance.

clips.episodeTitle: Freed British-Israeli welcomed outside of Tottenham stadium
clips.synopsis: Former British-Israeli hostage Emily Damari was greeted by chants of "she's one of our own" outside Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.

longformData.description: Travels across the UK to celebrate the Jewish festival of Passover

longformData.description: Shehab Khan follows the holy month of Ramadan and sees how it's observed

longformData.title: Gymnastics: A Culture of Abuse?
longformData.description: The former gymnasts & their powerful fight for justice

longformData.title: Trump: The Return?
longformData.description: Journalist Robert Moore lifts the lid on Donald Trump's latest comeback

longformData.title: The Clinic
longformData.description: Timely documentary about the history of a controversial NHS unit

longformData.title: ITV News: PMQs
longformData.description: Watch every moment of Prime Minister's Questions

longformData.title: Air India Flight 171: Disaster in the Skies
longformData.description: ITV News correspondents around the world report on the Air India Flight 171 plane crash

longformData.title: Diddy: The Rise and Fall of Hip-Hop's 'Bad Boy'
longformData.description: How Sean Combs went from stardom to one of the most high profile trials in US history.

longformData.title: Cold Case Justice: Solving the Murder of Louisa Dunne
longformData.description: Detectives hunt Louisa Dunne's killer to solve one of the UK's oldest cold cases.

longformData.title: The Evolution of Putin: Bullied Child, KGB Man, Autocrat
longformData.description: The strange stories of Vladimir Putin's past, told by three people who encountered him.

longformData.title: Disunited Kingdom?
longformData.description: Sabet Choudhury explores the factors behind last summer's anti-immigration riots.

longformData.title: The 97th Oscars Nominations Live
longformData.description: ITV News Special.

longformData.title: Antarctica: End of the Earth
longformData.description: ITV News journeys to Antarctica - a breathtaking wilderness disappearing faster than ever.

longformData.title: Remembering 7/7: 20 Years On
longformData.description: Memories of pain, grief and heroism from individuals who endured 7/7

longformData.title: ITV News Special: Britain’s Backstreet Surgery Scandal
longformData.description: ITV News investigates the rapid rise of backstreet cosmetic surgery treatments

longformData.title: Decoy: The Covert Trap to Catch a Killer
longformData.description: How a groundbreaking covert police operation caught a killer

longformData.title: Ukraine's Stolen Children
longformData.description: Compelling story of the children taken to Russia after war broke out
